title.narrative: OUTPUT 4.3: EDUCATION IN EMERGENCIES

description.narrative: By 2024, Learning institutions in target communities affected by crises are operational and accessible to children and adolescents. , which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Access To Quality Learning Opportunities (Covid), Cross Sectoral - Children With Disabilities, Cross Sectoral - Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2024, more children (5â€“17 years), especially adolescent girls, acquire competencies through access to quality and inclusive learning.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2024, Learning institutions in target communities affected by crises are operational and accessible to children and adolescents.

description.narrative: UNICEF supported education continuity for 11,754,023 students (6 062 699 girls) who had interrupted education due to various crises including covid19. In addition, School managers as well as members of some NGOs were trained on several topics related to education in emergencies. 367,125 (176,361 girls) in humanitarian crisis were supported by UNICEF through temporary learning areas, learning materials and teachers training. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:27/12/2021
